metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3905 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
External triggered memory leak in Open vSwitch while processing fragmented packets

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-ipsec - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-pki - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-source - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-switch - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-test - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
openvswitch-vtep - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
python3-openvswitch - 2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.16.0-0ubuntu2.1').
